alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 4:00PM EST until February 26 at 1:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Conewango Creek At Russell affecting Warren County. For the Conewango Creek...including Russell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Conewango Creek At Russell. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Both banks begin to overflow, affecting low lying areas. At 9.0 feet, A number of homes on the right, or west bank are affected by high water. At 10.0 feet, A number of homes on the right, or west bank are affected. The roadway on the left bank is also affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 9.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM EST Wednesday was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.4 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 700 AM EST.
